comment: Dr. Reichert is an amazing teacher. She is very caring and really cares about the subject. There are many in-class discussions and group work as well as independent work. I highly recommend her. There is also a lot of reading and interpreting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: I would definitely take a class with this professor again. She is very sweet and caring. Provides assistance to those with learning disabilities. The class is simple as long as you show up and listen you'll get an easy A. There is multiple extra credit opportunities. There is a bit much of reading and discussions but nothing too crazy. Excellent!

This class can be an issue for ESL students with a lot of readings. Prof. was kind to help her students to understand the contents & accomplish their writing papers. Quizzes or D2L discussions were almost every week. However, her effort to have everyone get involved in every topic helped me understand the US more. She will retire soon so take her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Consider the grammar of following paragraph and my grade. Decent amount of writing, different every year, 4 big blog post, average 4 post each. has some smaller blog post and stuff. Participation is a thing, reply to other student big blog post, discussion etc. Lots of work but are easy. No quiz and tests. She actually care about the students.

Prof. Reichert is an amazing teacher that you can tell really loves her students! Her lectures are very interesting to listen to and often spark classwide discussions. Participation is important and part of your grade in the class (though most things are graded based on completion) so if you're more on the quiet side I'd be mindful of that.

The class is pretty straightforward if you listen to her instructions and turn things in on time. I would say there is a lot of writing, but it is spread pretty equally so it is not too overwhelming. Going to class does matter a good bit because it will help you get extra credit and participation credit.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She was a great teacher she is lenient grader when it comes to late work only if it's not days late. She does have a lot of homework but it's not hard I did it all in one to two hours just because I got into it. This is a great class to take if you you need an easy English course grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great teacher that clearly enjoys what she does. She kept the class interesting with in class games and discussions. Just do all the assignments and go to class and you should get an easy A.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Might as well be an online class. Everything you do is on a blog and she grades from a blog. No point in coming to class since everything is online. Easy grader but a lot of work! No limits on how long your blogs/papers have to be, just need to get the point across. If you don't mind doing all the work then take this class for an easy A.
Very straight forward class. She definitely has her own opinions, but never criticizes others views. Extra credit applied to your final grade if you attended  her class regularly. Easy A.

A very tedious class, with excessive amounts of work for the course. Required to be taken. A nice professor, always willing to help outside of class (not needed for this course though). Some did not get along with her, I had no problems. Fair grading by expectations set forth on the first day of class.

Clear guide lines and specific rubric. Go to class, follow instructions, do the work, and an A is yours. HOWEVER, compared to other English classes, she gave an overwhelming amount of homework, not difficult, but tedious. I'd strongly recommend her if she hadn't constrained us to only writing about War. It was more like History than English...

Nice woman, very experienced. There's so much to learn from her and to be jealous of her. Can be a little overwhelming sometimes, but the HH class is quite easy. Except there's too much work assigned for such a class.
Nice lady, and pretty good teacher. The problem is she assigns too much work for this class. Other than that she is helpful and the class is easy.

The class takes no brains to pass, but Dr. Reichert was an enjoyable professor eiter way. Her discussions were asimilar to other general topics covered by most teachers and therefore very interesting. Nice lady overall and very respectful. Easy easy A.

She is a great teacher. Yes you are required to read a lot of novels and short stories and comment on them in journal entries. Every class is setup in a class discussion. whatever is discussed will be on the tests. She gives 3 tests, 1 paper, and multiple journal quotes and responses.

It was a lot of work for a 3 hour class but she made it as interesting as I could imagine a Lit class being.  Grade is affected by tardies, absences and participation.  My favorite thing about her is she let everyone have an opinion and from what I can tell she never penalized anybody for having one or disagreeing with her. This is rare for a PhD

Attendance is mandatory. she expects you to read and participate in group discussions almost every day, and it can be a very annoying class. Lots of reading and journals due every week. I did not enjoy the class.
Helped me out when I messed up at the end of the semester.  Absolutely recomended!

I've taken her twice and both times were real fun. I'd recommend her to anyone. She lays out exactly what you need to do to get an A on your portfolio and as long as you do them, you should get the grade you ask for (which you have to do in your letter of self evaluation). She makes writing really interesting and fun!

I took her for creative writing and it was really fun.  She got to know us one on and one and had good topics for us to write about. There were no tests just portfolios with a lot of material in them but there were only 3. Pretty fun and easy.
Enlgish 1102, easy class got an A. just do all the stuff she tell u to do and ull get an A.

Alot of reading in this class, more than I've ever had before. The class itself is easy and as long as you do the work (which is easy) and read all the stories you will get an A. She has an annoying habit of making every class a discussion class and sometimes its really awkward.
Really goo dlit teacher, and a blast to have in college.

I took composition with Dr. Reichert in 2000.  She must have been a pretty decent teacher because here I am 4 years later giving her a good rating.  I had a great time in both classes, and am glad to know she's still teaching at SPSU.

Great professor. Everything is laid out clearly for you in the syllabus (and her website). Show up and turn everything in on time and get a guaranteed B, put forth a little effort and get an A.  She actually teaches some useful techniques to writing which I am grateful for. Highly recommend.
Best English Professor I had!
great teacher. gives a lot of work but makes the class enjoyable. first time i really didnt mind that much writing the papers. wonderful teacher.
Can't go wrong here. Great class, good material.
Very good teacher.  Actually involved the class in what she was teaching.  Just follow her guidelines and it is downhill from there.
No Comments

yea she was awesome, took here for a second semester (diff class though) not many teachers id like to sign up for a second time but if i needed any more englishs, id look to see if she offered, yes lots of work,but layed out word for word on sylubus

While she can be a bit stern and while she does pour on a heavy workload, her class was still very easy.  Her in-class exercises, including interchange chat sessions and full class workshops, can be a bit tedious, though.
awesomne prof, follow the sylubus and you will be fine
Follow the syllabus for an easy A; Very helpful
